channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 中国在太空计划上的花费比任何国家都多，美国除外。卫星是一个特别值得关注的领域。美国军舰要小心了 👇。
item.description:
China spends more on its space programme than any country bar America. An area of particular concern is satellites.

American warships should watch out https://t.co/WVHZYoixDc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 最新研究显示，全球最便宜的 20 座城市中有 9 座位于亚洲。但亚洲大陆也有一些世界上最昂贵的大都市👇。
item.description:
Nine of the world’s 20 cheapest cities are in Asia, according to new research. But the continent is also home to some of the world’s most exorbitant metropolises https://t.co/2iZn68eW6a 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 印度菜很棒。也许太好了
item.description:
Indian food is great. Perhaps too great https://t.co/5SRob5Wy6T

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 我们的玻璃天花板指数衡量女性在劳动力中的作用和影响力。在此更深入地了解每个指标和国家：#InspireInclusion #IWD2024
item.description:
Our glass-ceiling index measures the role and influence of women in the workforce. Explore each indicator and country in more depth here: https://t.co/EkN2eMQIct#InspireInclusion #IWD2024 pic.twitter.com/zmNoNakGwr

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 全球化可能并没有加剧收入不平等
item.description:
Globalisation may not have increased income inequality, after all https://t.co/VixmmA8KwG

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 中国全国人民代表大会的召开揭示了中国政治和经济的糟糕状况 👇
item.description:
The gathering of China’s National People’s Congress reveals much about the woeful state of the country’s politics and economy https://t.co/NpjGPYJKJj 👇

item.title: 妇女的工作条件是否有所改善？我们从 2013 年开始衡量进展情况。以下是自那时以来的变化情况 #IWD2024
item.description:
Are working conditions getting any better for women? We started measuring progress in 2013. Here’s how things have changed since then https://t.co/rycFMb2xfK #IWD2024

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 8, 2024

item.title: 臃肿和群体思维的混合体有助于解释为什么美国的精英大学会在入学和言论方面与公众发生冲突。如果学校有更有效的管理，这两个问题都会得到更好的解决 👇
item.description:
A mix of bloat and groupthink helps explain why America’s elite universities find themselves at odds with the public in battles over access and speech.

Both problems would be better handled if the schools had more effective governance https://t.co/pYT4m3ULEY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 中国全国人民代表大会发出的信号并不令人放心。这些信号表明，中国缺乏应对经济衰退的有力计划，权力正进一步集中在习近平手中。
item.description:
The signals from China’s National People’s Congress are not reassuring.

They suggest the country lacks a robust plan to deal with its economic slump, and that power is concentrating even further in the hands of Xi Jinping https://t.co/9HulIbOrai 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 中国总理在其年度 "工作报告 "中谈到了经济中 "挥之不去的风险和隐患"。政府有一个解决问题的计划，只是这个计划不太可能奏效 👇。
item.description:
China’s prime minister spoke of “lingering risks and hidden dangers” to the economy in his annual “work report”. That is putting it mildly.

The government has a plan to fix things, just not one that is likely to work https://t.co/Gc1nj1hmal 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 宇宙的大部分都不见了。你所看到的原子和光线--从人类到行星、恒星和星系--只占宇宙的 5%。物理学家们现在倾向于一种涉及隐藏宇宙的理论👇。
item.description:
Most of the universe is missing. The atoms and light you see—from people to planets, stars and galaxies—make up just 5% of the universe. The rest is a two-part mystery.

Physicists are now gravitating towards a theory involving a hidden universe https://t.co/wGNr4qrKcO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 斋月可能给加沙带来喘息机会，也可能导致暴力加剧
item.description:
Ramadan could see respite for Gaza, or widening violence https://t.co/1UPNYN1Z5O

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.description:
The last scraps of the Haitian state are evaporating https://t.co/0Cb4QVm9xu

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 2024年，承认公众的悲观情绪就是对习近平的怀疑👇。
item.description:
In 2024, to acknowledge public gloom is to doubt Xi Jinping.

Read why China’s confidence crisis is going unfixed https://t.co/7QopeMP6bm 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）近来对以色列的态度更加强硬，但他不会停止以色列的战争。面对国内外与日俱增的压力，这位美国总统将赌注押在了人质协议上👇。
item.description:
Joe Biden has sharpened his tone towards Israel of late, but will not stop its war. Facing mounting pressure at home and abroad, the American president is betting on a hostage deal https://t.co/tNPysUb5UO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 女性仍在努力突破玻璃天花板。我们的指数衡量了在劳动力参与、薪酬、带薪育儿假、政治代表性等领域的改善速度 #IWD2024
item.description:
Women are still struggling to break through the glass ceiling. Our index measures the pace of improvement in such areas as labour-force participation, salaries, paid parental leave, political representation and more https://t.co/LbHKW8NXb8 #IWD2024

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 即使杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）没有改变保守党的选举前景，他也让工党在英国大选前的日子更加难过👇。
item.description:
Even if Jeremy Hunt has not changed the Conservatives’ electoral prospects, he has made life more difficult for the Labour Party ahead of Britain’s general election https://t.co/prVdyI7g3R 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 第三党候选人可能会给美国总统大选带来任何影响。但他们能进入选票吗？ 👇
item.description:
Third-party candidates could tip America’s presidential election either way. But will they get on the ballot? https://t.co/p6DU6t7Xce 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 本周的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @DSORennie将聆听政治学家裴敏欣讲述中国监控国家的力量所在 🎧。
item.description:
This week on our “Drum Tower” podcast, @aliceysu and @DSORennie hear from political scientist Minxin Pei about what powers China’s surveillance state https://t.co/JvqpnEFuYo 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 在 "情报 "节目中，@moekaimnida 报道了日本城镇在老龄化社会中努力转变育儿观念的情况。
item.description:
On “The Intelligence”, @moekaimnida reports from the Japanese towns trying to transform attitudes towards childcare in an ageing society https://t.co/JgziW6om5k pic.twitter.com/nVjBrSLFOF

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 中国正走在重建美国庞大而复杂的宇宙能力网络的道路上。其结果可能是一个相互确保太空脆弱性的时代👇。
item.description:
China is on a path to recreating America’s vast and sophisticated network of capabilities in the cosmos. The result might be an era of mu­tually assured vulnerability in space https://t.co/0qCbbr4LHa 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 石墨烯强度高、重量轻、柔韧性好，是优良的导电体。自石墨烯首次被分离出来以来的 20 年里，它还没有太多有用的应用。这种情况正在开始改变👇。
item.description:
Graphene is strong, lightweight, flexible and an excellent conductor of electricity. It hasn’t had many useful applications in the 20 years since it was first isolated. That is beginning to change https://t.co/DBszHClNSX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: KAL 的漫画

KAL’s cartoon https://t.co/TdfzMQZfJC

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将在美国总统大选中一决雌雄，这似乎不可避免。但考虑到这场竞选的特殊性，不确定性比您想象的要多 👇
item.description:
It may seem inevitable that America’s presidential election will be between Joe Biden and Donald Trump. But given the oddities specific to this contest, there is more uncertainty than you might think https://t.co/9694z88eSb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 7, 2024
